info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 06 at 3:01PM EDT until June 06 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Rensselaer County in east central New York... * Until 330 PM EDT. * At 301 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Grafton, or 8 miles west of Hoosick Falls, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Grafton, Brunswick, Pittstown, Schaghticoke, Valley Falls, Clums Corner, Raymertown, Millertown, Quackenkill, Potter Hill, Babcock Lake, Johnsonville, Lincolnville, Tamarack, Factory Hollow, Boyntonville, East Grafton, Tomhannock, Haynersville and Cropseyville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
